content: Earlier versions had Tools>options. That is now Tools>settings. It is unclear what you plan to do. Usually, if a user has a new password for account, a request for mail will return a prompt that the current password that thunderbird has does not work and prompts for the new one.

content:
Please explain this "only some of them".

I could see this happening if you have a POP account configured in Thunderbird and are getting mail in folders other than the inbox on the server. As POP is limited to the inbox I have no trouble seeing this at all.

As for IMAP account which are the majority these days, they get mail from whatever folders are subscribed. Usually all of them

content: It would be in the active profile c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles.ini is a text file you can open with notepad and it gives the name of the profile that is in c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles

Se la cartella non è elencata, non la si può "scompattare"...

Se l'account è IMAP verifica che la cartella che cerchi sia tra quelle selezionate per la sincronizzazione -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/sincronizzazione-imap#w_configurazione-della-sincronizzazione-ed-utilizzo-dello-spazio-sul-disco

Se l'account è POP3 non c'è molto da fare, assicurati eventualmente di non averla eliminata per sbaglio.

content:
Salve, ringrazio innanzitutto per la tempestiva risposta.

Il server utilizzato è POP3.

A questo punto è verosimile l'ipotesi che la sottocartella sia stata eliminata accidentalmente (non l'avrei mai fatto volontariamente).

Sul client Thunderbird della mia postazione principale è presente il filtro di cui all'immagine allegata, che trasferisce in automatico tutta la posta proveniente dagli abbonati nella sottocartella Abbonati.

La domanda n. 1 è: cosa succede se il programma non trova più la sottocartella Abbonati? Stando a quanto si verificato, sembrerebbe che le mail di quei mittenti non vengano visualizzate.

La domanda n. 2 (scusate, non per essere tedioso, solo per organizzare meglio il mio quesito) è: se ricreo adesso la sottocartella Abbonati, posso inoltrare nuovamente da webmail gli ultimi messaggi degli abbonati, in modo che finiscano nella nuova sottocartella appena creata?

Avrei anche una (ehm...) domanda n. 3: nella parte bassa del mio client (che gestisce 7 account) è presente l'elenco Cartelle unificate (come da immagine allegata). Cosa si intende per "Cartelle unificate"?

Che devo dire? Immensamente grato per la pazienza di chi è arrivato alla fine del testo...

content:
Segui queste operazioni di manutenzione


  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

content:
Here are the basics:

  1. for IMAP just create in thunderbird, and all messages will be there
  2. for POP, select each folder, highlight all messages, click tools>export as mbox
  3. for addressbook, use the export option to create csv format
  4. install importexporttools addon if not already done
  5. in thunderbird, highlight Local Folders, rightclick and select importexporttools option to import mbox, do for each exported folder
  6. setup your POP account. you now have folders in account and prior ones in Local Folders. they can be merged, but that's another task that i am bypassing here.
  7. import the csv addressbook to thunderbird. that can be a little tricky, getting all fields aligned. That sometimes takes a few tries.

I think these steps will get you started.
creator: davidsk

content:
I don't know about the colours but here's how to get rid of Conversation View/threading.

Firstly press Alt-v and click "Sort by" on the drop-down menu that appears. Towards the bottom of that are "Threaded" and "Unthreaded." Click "Unthreaded."

That will sort out the folder you are currently displaying but only that one.

To make it work in every folder right-click somewhere on the line with the column headings and choose "Apply current view to folder and its children" at the bottom, then pick one of your accounts, then the top of the next list that comes up. See picture as hopefully that'll make it clearer.

You have to do it for every account you have.

content:
Some info will help. - click help>about and share what version you are using - now, click settings>general and scroll down to the Updates section and click the button that shows update history and report what the prior version was.

That may help, as a version installed years ago would not upgrade to an unsupported version. An unsupported version can only be installed from other distribution sources than Thunderbird's. Knowing that may help is advising how to avoid this. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

It's best to continue the conversation in the original question.

But it would be helpful if you tell us what version you are using at the moment.

All update info will be here :

  • Settings > General
  • scroll down to 'Updates' section
  • clickon 'Show update history'
  • Post an image of what it says.

Info also here: In Thunderbird Help > About Thunderbird What version does it say you are using ?

You can also find information here: Help > Troubleshooting Information

content:
This is a common problem where two or more accounts are attempting to use the same SMTP server. To resolve this, my suggestion is to:

  1. click to 'account settings' and then locate the 'Outgoing Server SMTP)' link in left column below accounts
  2. that lists all SMTP servers and there should be one for each account
  3. click 'edit' on each one and update the DESCRIPTION field of each to be unique
  4. then, click 'account settings' and highlight an account and review the bottom line of that pane which shows the SMTP server. It should display the unique name you assigned to it. Then, repeat for the other account. This is your assurance that each account has its own SMTP server defined.
creator: davidsk
